title: Spells by Champion
body:
What do you think about saving spells by champion. Like if you select Warwick, spells automatically switch to ignite, smite.

Or if you chose Blitz, spells automatically switch to heal, exhaust.

Surely it wouldn't be too hard to save spell preferences to champs.

How many times has a JG forgotten smite. But if spells could be saved by champ it could help.

replies.body: What about Champs that play more than one role? It's not very hard to change your summs

Not many people play a champ in more than one role. I know If I select Warwick, I'm JG. If I select Blitz, I'm sup. If I select Tryndamyre, I'm top. 

Why not just change the spells accordingly.
Because sometimes I like to play Leona jungle, that's why

Becuase maybe you have a trndramyre jungle or maybe an ad bruiser blitzcrank top (sounds stupid but if you're bored of sup blitz, this build is hard to get started but once you have a few items you'll be by far the scariest person on your team since nobody can fight you).

Also as a support main, my choice between flash+exhaust or flash+ignite depends heavily on matchup, not the champion I'm playing but the enemy.

Also toplaners might want to take ignite > tp against say a darius or illoai, or exhaust>tp against a riven or a jax; if they aren't confident they can win lane hard against these champions.

Summoners spells typically stay the same but sometimes you might need to switch them up, especially in certain matchups. Taking the same spells every time, regardless of matchup is a very bronze thing to do.
 That's just my silver and my platinum coach's 2cents on the matter.

I mean, its a neat idea but there are a lot of other things higher on the list before this.

Like the ability to reorder your rune and mastery pages without deleting and remaking. A tab where you can see your (ward) skins. A shop that forgets where you  were when you click out of it for 1 second. etc

See I just had another game where I chose Shaco, and forgot to chose smite. It would be nice when I chose Shaco that it automatically changed my spells to include smite.

I have also had games this week where the JG has forgotten smite. My solution would have fixed that.

Are you guys saying, you have never forgotten to change spells when you go from JG to another lane, or vice versa?

tbh in a ranked match unless it's bronze, odds are that your jungler will have smite. If anything they might have taken the wrong runes or masteries but summoners is a hard mistake to make and draft pick gives you more than enough time to check your runes, masteries and especially summoners. Heck it even gives you enough time to deliberate over which skin you want to play.
Are you saying that you have never played a champion in both jungle and Lane in separate games? What if I main jungle Graves but want to take him top?
It wouldn't take much to save your spells at champion select, and when you change champs it changes spells.
Riot probably doesn't find it worth their time to create a system that only saves four clicks in champ select (usually two, as people keep Flash).

Yeah but so many people forget to change spells when they change champs. And it wouldn't be hard to do something like, chose a champ, and it changes the spells to the last ones you used on that champ.
Yep. This might be more of a public awareness issue tho
